item.title: Highguard Website is Currently Down
item.content:encoded:
The Highguard website is experiencing issues and is currently unavailable.

Wildlight Entertainment’s latest shooter, Highguard, has not been experiencing the smoothest launch, with player counts dwindling as the days go by. The developers recently announced mass layoffs, with “most of the team” affected. Now the website has been affected as well.

Highguard Website Unavailable

At the time of writing, if you head over to the Highguard website (via Wario64 on Twitter), you will see that the site is down and has been for some time. The error pop-up states “SITE UNAVAILABLE. This site is currently unavailable. Please contact [email protected] for assistance.” No other information was revealed, and the developers have not provided any clarity yet.

Highguard developers recently released a big update for the title, in the hopes of bringing more players to the game. Episode 2 features new heroes, a ranked 3v3 competitive playlist where players can climb through 7 ranks, a new map, and additional quality-of-life improvements and bug fixes. However, this addition has not helped bring up the concurrent numbers.

Several factors could have led to Highguard’s failure, including the Game Awards 2025 finale moment, the social media blackout, and more. Interested readers can check out a full guide on it here.

In other news, a tech artist who worked on Highguard has reflected on the highs and lows of the game’s development and launch. Additionally, the 5v5 Raid Mode has been made permanent. What are your thoughts on the Highguard website being down? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Xbox Streaming Apps being down and how cloud saves are impacted. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1705: Hints and Answer for February 18, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1705 for February 18, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, February 18, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1705 is a pretty easy puzzle. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4 out of 6 guesses. That makes it almost a full guess easier than the 4.8-guess average from February 17.

General Wordle Hints For February 18

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word refers to a person, not an object or action.
  • Hint 2: It’s most often used in business, media, or industry contexts.
  • Hint 3: The term suggests influence or control, rather than a formal title.
  • Hint 4: You’re more likely to see it used informally in headlines than in official documents.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1705 for February 18, 2026.

Starter Words For February 18, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • GLOOM
  • LUMPS
  • MOULD
  • LOGIC

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1705 On February 18, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: MOGUL

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

MOGUL is a noun that can mean “a bump or mound of hard snow on a ski slope.” It can also mean “an important or powerful person”.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1704 on February 17, 2026

Answer: SQUAD

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1705?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 19 will be Wordle Game #1706.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

More from Mike Straw

item.title: How Long To Beat Resident Evil Requiem? Resident Evil 9 Game Length & Total Hours, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem’s game length could stop you from buying the game—don’t lie, it’s because you’re too scared. If you are legitimately concerned about how long Capcom’s latest entry is, this guide should provide clarity.

Previous Resident Evil games have always had a decent length to them, with some being way longer than others. The RE speedruns are legendary, with players mopping up the main story in one brief sitting. If this is putting you off Resident Evil Requiem, let’s take a look at what you can expect.

How Many Hours To Beat Resident Evil Requiem?

There have been conflicting reports about Resident Evil Requiem’s game length, but based on sources, you should expect around 10-16 hours of main-game content, with completionist save files expected to clock in around 30-40 hours.

Reports have been circling about the game’s length, but truth be told, no one has an exact bearing on Requiem’s game length yet.

Three voices have managed to give a ballpark region for the game’s runtime: The director, the producer, and long-time leaker Dusk Golem.

Initially, it was suggested by the game’s producer that Requiem would be comparable to Resident Evil 4 in terms of game length. Everyone’s mileage varies, but the fourth main game is up there with one of the longest runtimes for main content. It’s amazing how much extra time is added for having crazy chainsaw people cut Leon’s head off.

  • More Insider Gaming: Resident Evil Requiem Director Talks Leon’s ‘Ruthless Anger’

This gave everyone hope that Resident Evil 9 would also be a meaty adventure. Since then, the game’s director has come out and said the horror title’s length is hard to gauge. Finally, Dusk Golem—who provided details on Resident Evil Requiem’s review embargo date—gave information on what they knew:

“I’ve heard myself it’s longer than Village, but a bit shorter than RE:4.”

Village’s game length (particularly for a first-time playthrough) is around the 10-hour mark. So, even if Requiem finds a healthy middle ground, the first playthrough should be around 12-14 hours, with a wider margin of 10-16 hours capturing everything—not too shabby.

Obviously, the details are more hit and miss than the original Resident Evil’s dialogue. The expected game length mark shouldn’t be too far short if it is.

How Does Resident Evil 9 Compare To Other Resident Evil Games?

Resident Evil Requiem’s game length sounds like it’s more in keeping with recent Resident Evil games, rather than the earlier entries, which were very short in comparison.

You get indie horror games nowadays that are longer than the original Resident Evil trilogy entries! Resi 4 really advanced the series and gave players a long and winding adventure. It’s been fairly consistent ever since.

  • More Insider Gaming: Resident Evil Requiem’s Leon is a Brutal Powerhouse To Offset Grace’s Weakness

According to HowLongToBeat (which aggregates playthrough from hundreds and thousands of players), here’s the average playtime for every mainline Resident Evil game—and we’re using the remakes where applicable.

Have you heard anything different about Resident Evil Requiem’s game length? Let the team (and the people) know via our free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

If you’re on PlayStation, read about Resident Evil Requiem running at 4K60 on PS5 Pro.

item.title: WWE 2K26 Universe Mode Wizard Lets You Control Everything
item.content:encoded:
WWE 2K26 is bringing plenty of changes to the popular Universe Mode.

The latest Ringside Report feature on WWE 2K26 showcased the wide variety of changes coming to Universe Mode. The name of the game is control in WWE 2K26, and this year’s Universe Mode provides even more options for players to meticulously manipulate the in-game sandbox while also allowing for set-it-and-forget-it options for those who just want to kick back and watch a simulated Universe.

You’re a Wizard, WWE

This year’s WWE Universe Mode features a new Universe Wizard that lets players choose which weekly shows and PLEs to feature, assign Superstars to each show and their champions, and set the calendar start month. Players can choose an existing show, such as WWE Monday Night Raw. However, they can also either import a show they downloaded or start from scratch with a brand-new creation.

Players can edit details for default shows like Raw and SmackDown, including rosters, championships, and divisions. Each show supports up to eight titles across men’s and women’s divisions, including tag team and intergender titles, plus two Money in the Bank briefcases.

More Customization Options in Universe Mode for WWE 2K26

WWE 2K26 expands Universe mode with new match setup options, including enhanced settings and sliders. Players can now adjust matchmaking sliders to fine-tune match card sorting, scoring, and bonuses for title matches, rivalries, and match types.

For those who want to start from scratch, there are settings to remove all default rivalry options and start with a blank canvas.

Promo options are also updated. This year, players have even more control over the outcome of Universe Mode promos. When challenging a rival to a match, the challenger can now directly select the match stipulations. Players can take the direction of their promos in new avenues, including babyface and heel turns.

There are also customization options for wrestlers’ attire for weekly shows, pay-per-view events, and WrestleMania. Once again, allowing even more customization options.

Are you excited for WWE 2K26? Sound off in our official Discord server. For more WWE 2K26, learn about the additional changes coming to the Creation Suite. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: When Will Steam Deck Consoles Be Back In Stock? Out Of Stock Status, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Gamers hoping to pick up a Steam Deck in 2026 could face quite a battle, as Valve is among those who have been hit by the widespread RAM issues, leading to stock shortages.

Out-of-stock alerts for Steam Deck models in the United States have caused a stir, with uncertainty about when Steam Decks will be available for purchase again.

If you’ve encountered stock shortages when trying to purchase a Steam Deck, Insider Gaming has all the details on the availability of the console and when it could be available to purchase.

When Will Steam Deck Be Back in Stock?

Valve has provided no indication of when Steam Decks will be back available, and it could be a while until the systems are back on the first-hand market.

Like most tech companies, Valve is having to cope with the lack of available RAM, which is also affecting the likes of Nintendo, potentially pushing up the price of the Switch 2. Unfortunately, this is completely out of their hands, and there is no indication that demand will be reduced anytime soon.

Valve’s storefront in the US states that Steam Deck models may be unavailable “intermittently in some regions,” and there’s no indication of when products will be back on the market.

The shortage of RAM is expected to remain a problem throughout 2026 and potentially into 2027, with it expected that it will cause a delay to the release date for next-generation consoles from the likes of Xbox and PlayStation.

Will The Steam Deck LCD Model be Available Again?

No, Valve will not have the LCD Steam Deck model available again, as the console has been discontinued entirely.

Valve is no longer making the LCD Steam Deck models, which were a cheaper entry point for fans, and will not be restocking the console on its website.

This means that if you’re on the hunt for a Steam Deck LCD Model, the only options available are the second-hand market, which is likely seeing a price increase, too, given the demand for the consoles.

Have you had any luck trying to buy a Steam Deck recently? Share your experience in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, check out the release of Dino Crisis 1 & 2 on Steam, and find out the controller support details for Mewgenics.

item.title: WWE 2K26 Introduces Nintendo Switch 2-Exclusive Creation Tools
item.content:encoded:
WWE 2K26 completely overhauls elements of the Creation Suite, including new additions exclusive to Nintendo Switch 2.

The latest WWE 2K Ringside Report features updates to the Creation Suite. It was previously announced that the number of created wrestler slots would increase from 100 to 200. That is twice as many opportunities to create new wrestlers and bring existing non-WWE stars to your roster, either by creating your own versions or by downloading them in Community Creations.

It’s also now known that Create-an-Image slots have doubled. This means there are now 2,000 free slots available to create custom images. You can also find custom images on Community Creations. Nintendo Switch 2 now features the image uploader for the first time. They’ve also added the ability to use the Joy-Con 2’s mouse controls for greater precision when customizing your wrestler.

Even More Customization Options in Create-a-Superstar

Additionally, the Create-a-Superstar offers many more direct control options. The layer system has been improved. Previously, there were 60 layers across the entire Custom Superstar. Now, the head and body are in separate sections, while the attire options are drawn from separate pools. In total, there are 60 layers for attire and 40 for head and body. Players can also choose from 40+ body templates as a starting point and further customize the body with morphing tools.

Plus, there are all-new two-tone hair blending options for even more creativity and authenticity.

That’s Not All Coming to Creation in WWE 2K26

Additional updates to the Creation Suite include a revamped menu for Create-a-Championship and Money in the Bank. This section also includes new available championship parts.

They also added advanced timelines to entrance customizations and the ability to create victory and entrance motions for four-person and five-person stables.

For more on what has been revamped in WWE 2K26, check out the only battle pass system known as the Ringside Pass.

Are you excited for WWE 2K26? Sound off in our official Discord server. For more WWE 2K26, learn about the additional changes coming to the game for Nintendo Switch 2. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
